body.name: TCL 85-Inch QM8 QLED 4K Smart Mini LED TV with Google (85QM850G, 2023 Model) Dolby Vision, Atmos, HDR Ultra, Game Accelerator up to 240Hz, Voice Remote, Works Alexa, Streaming Television
deliveryMessages: FREE scheduled delivery as soon as Tuesday, February 20, 8 AM - 11 AM
features: 85 INCH MINI LED TV: Experience incredible detail with our TCL 85-Inch QM8 QLED 4K Smart Mini LED TV; With up to 2,300 local dimming zones that dynamically adapt to on-screen content for ultra deep blacks and ultra bright whites without image blooming

QLED - QUANTUM DOT TECHNOLOGY: With Quantum Dot Technology and UltraWide Color Gamut, enjoy over a billion colors for rich and lifelike images; Paired with a HighBright Pro LED Backlight, this 85 inch QLED TV creates dazzling specular highlights

HDR ULTRA: With HDR ULTRA, which includes Dolby Vision IQ, HDR10, HDR10+, and HLG, our TCL 85 inch TV outshines typical flat screen TVs by offering stunning picture clarity, an expanded color spectrum, and incredible contrast for lifelike visuals

MOTION RATE 480 AND MEMC FRAME INSERTION: Leap into action with this 85 inch flatscreen TV; Equipped with Motion Rate 480 and MEMC frame insertion, this 4K UHD TV combines multiple motion enhancement technologies for best-in-class motion clarity

GAME ACCELERATOR 240: Elevate your gaming with this exceptional gaming TV; This native 120Hz TV, with the ability to go up to 240Hz VRR powered by AMD FreeSync, is perfect for not only fast-paced video games, but action-packed movies and live sports as well
body.description: TCL Q Class Smart TVs combine stunning 4K HDR and Mini-LED technology in a bold, brushed metal bezel-less design for a true flagship 4K TV experience. With QLED Quantum Dot technology and HDR ULTRA with Dolby Vision IQ, you can enjoy enhanced contrast, vivid colors and fine details on this 85 inch QLED TV. TCL’s High Brightness ULTRA Direct LED Backlight produces up to 2,000 nits peak brightness for dazzling specular highlights, perfect for any viewing environment. MINI-LED ULTRA with up to 2300+ zones adapt to on-screen content for deep blacks without image blooming. Powered by TCL's AIPQ Engine Gen 3, this flat screen TV is equipped with an advanced processor that optimizes each scene with machine learning for an unrivaled cinematic experience. With a 120Hz native panel refresh rate with Motion Rate 480, this smart TV focuses on best-in-class motion clarity producing smooth video playback. With Game Accelerator 240 and Auto Game Mode gameplay is blistering fast keeping you ahead of the competition. For a no compromise experience the TCL Q Class Smart TVs are the ultimate 4K Mini LED TVs.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars OLED-level blacks with incredible brightness. Incredible value!
reviews.reviewText: The Sony in my living room broke and The Lady can't go long without her reality TV. So I replaced it with the 75" QM8.I read and saw the great reviews of this TV but I wasn't ready for just how good this TV is. Now, you have to take some time to get the brightness, color saturation and black level where you want (stick to movie for SDR and HDR and Dolby Vision bright for Dolby Vision). But once you do, this is what I notice:The black levels are OLED quality. I have the LG-C1 83" OLED in my theater room, and the QM8 is easily a match picture wise. But since the QM8 gets so bright, the specular highlights in HDR dwarfs what an OLED can do.The one flaw it has is the judder in *some* fast moving content. The upscaling of really old content is that great either. But modern tv looks great and anything 1080p and up looks SPECTACULAR. Love the TV so much I ordered the 98" for my theater room to replace the LG. It's that good!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Beats all expectations
reviews.reviewText: Out of the box, this TV has exceeded all expectations of quality. Built quality, assembly, and set up are all top notch. Screen quality is excellent; colors, clarity, brightness. Extremely happy so far!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This is a fantastic TV. The picture is amazing. 4k is a game changer. The ability to run all my streaming services rivals my apple tv. It also looks very sleek. Easily integrated with my home theater set up. The remote is also versatile and backlit which is a big plus. I can’t comment on the TV sound as I am playing through a 5.1 surround system. This TV is getting rave reviews on a lot of professional review sites and I can see why. An outstanding value.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Very Excellent Television $$$ 65"
reviews.reviewText: From all the reviews I saw on YouTube. They said this is a bright and colorful TV. Once I got it and tested everything out for myself...everything I've watched is very good except for dolby vision. It is dark and when I adjust it to the brightest for dolby vision it is not even watchable and I regret replacing my Vizio Oled for this. I can't even watch Disney plus cuz everything is dark. I should of got the hisense UK8 or just went all out and got an LG or Sony.UPDATE: 11-21-23Tv is actually a lot better after some calibrations I got online. Dolby Vision is better and hdr and hdr10 is excellent. Very bright tv and just good on dolby. I give thr tv 4 stars

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars TCL TV best ever compared a ton
reviews.reviewText: I have been looking and finding that all the name brands all had the same features as some of the lower price ones. I finally was able to see this TV at a friend house where it was simply the best picture I had seen is some time on a TV at a house. The TV is amazing and comes with a easy to use remote, if you want you can work on the settings and it looks great straight out the box and the internal sound is very good. Great screen in any light and amazing in dark room all the blacks are vibrant and clear. I would by another one if I had need for one.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 6, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars 75” QM8 TV arrived with defective backlight
reviews.reviewText: There were alot of misses here. So the Tv was ordered on June 25 and originally scheduled for delivery on 6/30. I received a call an hour before delivery and they informed me the tv arrived late to the warehouse and all delivery trucks already went out that morning and I had to reschedule delivery for 7/1. On 7/1 Amazon delivered and setup the 75” QM8 tv. Once they left I moved the tv gently against the wall on my tv stand and the tv’s backlight started to flicker on and off which each slight movement as if something was loose in the tv. When the back of the tv’ plastic cover (above rear subwoofer) was slightly tapped the backlight will go off and on. We ensured the tvs firmware was updated. The whole day of testing the tv regardless of what’s on the screen the tv would randomly flicker off for a half second and then back on with nothing but the power cable plugged into the tv. Later that same evening the flickering got worst until the backlight went completely out. We tried typical troubleshooting like power cycling and removing all hdmi cables and still nothing. As the backlight was out we could still see the faint text on the tv while it was powered on. (See my picture)Although the tv had phenomenal picture quality like inky OLED blacks and ultra bright whites which was expected from all the review sites I follow (Digital Trends, FOMO), I am disappointed as this is my first TCL tv. I hope this not an expected experience of TCL. Not sure the cause but the ball was dropped from manufacturing to delivery. That evening I called Amazon to request an exchange as I love the tv however they could only process it as a return and they couldn’t refund the money back to my credit card. They would only refund my purchase as an Amazon credit.On 7/5 The tv was picked up per Amazon and still awaiting my return status to update.I haven’t heard any reports from anyone regarding QM8 with a bad backlight and random flickering.I will give TCL one more shot as this TV was everything I was looking for coming from a 1080p Samsung that was a solid workhorse for over 12 years. Hope the second time is a charm.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Legit Premium Feel! (dim at times)
reviews.reviewText: My favorite YouTuber on digital trends recommended this TV. We have the premium TVs in our living spaces and home theater, but for our master bedroom we were okay with a step down. Fortunately, he did not lead us astray. It is a fantastic TV and I would highly recommend. The color accuracy and upscaling is amazing! I will say though with Roku, which is our primary method of viewing, it only offers the IQ settings out of the gate. And even the bright is dim at times. Not enough for me to deduct a star though.
